pull.title: Update the Windows build notes
pull.body:
- Clarify the Windows Subsystem For Linux section.
- Clarify the build requirements.

events.body: Removed the -j flags (my own and the ones that were present) and did a fixup/reword. @jonasschnelli and @sipa brought up good points regarding parallelism. Doing a parallel make on the depends portion caused several errors on my system. I was able to keep trying and get it to work but it wasn't ideal.

events.message:
Update the Windows build notes

- Clarify the Windows Subsystem For Linux section.
- Clarify the build requirements.

events.body: Also, just to clarify, I did successfully build and run the 32-bit version. `make check` passed too.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -68,7 +72,7 @@ Then build using:
     cd ..
     ./autogen.sh # not required when building from tarball
     CONFIG_SITE=$PWD/depends/x86_64-w64-mingw32/share/config.site ./configure --prefix=/
-    make
+    make -j4
comments.body: nit: not sure if we should set the `jobs` amount in the documentation. IMO we also don't do that for other build docs. It depends on available RAM/cores.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -68,7 +72,7 @@ Then build using:
     cd ..
     ./autogen.sh # not required when building from tarball
     CONFIG_SITE=$PWD/depends/x86_64-w64-mingw32/share/config.site ./configure --prefix=/
-    make
+    make -j4
comments.body: If you're going to add `-j` in places, at least explain that it impacts parallellism in a comment.
